title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4675-4681: Deciding Where to Dig Into the Boxworks
summary: Written by Michelle Minitti, MAHLI Deputy Principal Investigator at Framework Earth planning date: Friday, Oct. 3, 2025 Before Curiosity landed 13 years ago, the science team eyed all the geologic wonders scattered across the flanks of Mount Sharp and looked forward to the day when we could put the rover to work on them. title: Blue Origin launches twin Mars probes for NASA as New Glenn makes first landing
summary: Blue Origin launched its second heavy-lift New Glenn rocket Thursday, putting two small NASA satellites onto a long, looping course to Mars to learn more about how the sun has slowly blown away the red planet's once thick atmosphere.

title: New Glenn launches NASA’s ESCAPADE Mars mission, lands booster
summary:
Blue Origin successfully launched a NASA Mars mission on the second flight of its New Glenn booster Nov. 13, landing the vehicle’s first stage in the process.
The post New Glenn launches NASA’s ESCAPADE Mars mission, lands booster appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: A Robotic Helping Hand
summary: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim took this photo on July 23, 2025, as the International Space Station orbited 259 miles above a cloudy Pacific Ocean southwest of Mexico. Visible in the image is the 57.7-foot-long Canadarm2 robotic arm, which extends from a data grapple fixture on the International Space Station’s Harmony module. Attached to its latching […]

title: Project Kuiper becomes Amazon Leo ahead of LEO broadband service debut
summary:
Project Kuiper has shed its seven-year-old code name, emerging as Amazon Leo Nov. 13 as the company nears the start of initial broadband services from the low Earth orbit constellation next year.
The post Project Kuiper becomes Amazon Leo ahead of LEO broadband service debut appeared first on SpaceNews.
